metadata.title: CVE-2024-43868 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:riscv/purgatory: align riscv_kernel_entryWhen alignment handling is delegated to the kernel, everything must beword-aligned in purgatory, since the trap handler is then set to thekexec one. Without the alignment, hitting the exception wouldultimately crash. On other occasions, the kernel's handler would takecare of exceptions.This has been tested on a JH7110 SoC with oreboot and its SBI delegatingunaligned access exceptions and the kernel configured to handle them.
